result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the defendant to provide DNA sample. Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees and assessments by 07-27-2023; balance converted to civil judgment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 DAYS time served.
The Court ordered the defendant to provide DNA sample.  Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments by 7.27.2023; balance converted to civil judgment.  
  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  kmw

Defendant Marcus Jackson in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Defendant Marcus Jackson in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court holds colluquy with the defendant.  Based upon the defendant's statements, defendant may be public defender eligible. Attorney Travis Schwantes appears as a friend of the court. Counsel will look into eligibility status to be retained on this matter. Defense requests a preliminary waiver date and status. Case remains calendared in Br. 34.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus Jackson in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant ordered to comply with sex offender registry.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06/25/2022 IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Marcus Jackson in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @1:30p
